name: organophosphorus-compound production, unspecified | organophosphorus-compound, unspecified | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/193/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  organophosphorous-compounds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursors (acetaldehyde, acetic anhydride, aluminium hydroxide, ammonia, chlorine, ethanol, ethylene oxide, folmaldehyde, hydrochloric acid, methanol, nitric acid, phenol, phosphoric acid, phosphorous chloride,  phosphorus, soda ash, sodium chloride, sodium hydroxide, sulfur, sulfur dioxide, solfuric acid, and water decarbonised) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with organophosphorous-compounds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Organo-phosphorous compounds are mostly insecticides that contain a phosphorus atom bound to organic substituents, either alkyl or alkoxy groups. They are usually produced from phosphitesd, phosphoro dithioic acids, or phosphoroi chlorido thioates.; ;The dataset organo-phosphorus-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of chlorpyrifos, chlorpyrifos-methyl, dimethoate, ethephon, fosetyl-Al, glyphosate, and parathion-methyl.;;Chlorpyrifos is produced in five steps from acetaldehyde:;2 C2H4O + CH2O + NH3 → C5H5N + 3 H2O + H2;C5H5N + NaNH2 + H2O → C5H6N2 + H2 + NaOH;C5H6N2 + NaNO3 + H2SO4 → C5H5NO + NH3 + NaSO4 + NO2;C5H5NO + 3 Cl2 → C5H2Cl3NO + 3 HCl;C5H2Cl3NO + C4H10ClO2SP → C9H11Cl3NO3PS + HCl;Precursors that are used for the chlorpyrifos production are diethylthiophosphoryl chloride (DEPCT) (C4H10ClO2SP), sodium amide (NaNH2), and sodium nitrate (NaNO3).;;Chlorpyrifos-methyl is produced in five steps from acetaldehyde:;2 C2H4O + CH2O + NH3 → C5H5N + 3 H2O + H2;C5H5N + NaNH2 + H2O → C5H6N2 + H2 + NaOH;C5H6N2 + NaNO3 + H2SO4 → C5H5NO + NH3 + NaSO4 + NO2;C5H5NO + 3 Cl2 → C5H2Cl3NO + 3 HCl;C5H2Cl3NO + C2H6ClO2SP → C7H7Cl3NO3PS + HCl;Precursors that are used for the chlorpyrifos-methyl production are dimethylthiophosphoryl chloride (DMPCT) (C2H6ClO2SP), sodium amide (NaNH2), and sodium nitrate (NaNO3).;;Dimethoate is produced in four steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + SOCl2 → C2H2Cl2O + HCl + SO2;C2H2Cl2O + CH4N → C3H6ClNO + HCl;C3H6ClNO + C2H7O2PS2 → C5H12NO3PS2 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the dimethoate production are dimethyl dithiophosphoric acid (C2H7O2S2P), methylamine (CH5N), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Ethephon is produced in three steps from phosphorus trichloride:;PCl3 + C2H4O → C6H12Cl3O3P;C6H12Cl3O3P → C6H12Cl3O3P;C6H12Cl3O3P + 2 HCl → C2H4ClO3P + 2 C2H4Cl2;;Fosetyl-Al is produced in four steps from phosphorus trichloride:;PCl3 + 2 C2H6O + H2O → C4H11O3P + 3 HCl;C4H11O3P + H3PO3 → 2 C2H7O3P;C2H7O3P + C2H5ONa → C2H6O3PNa + C2H6O;3 C2H6O3PNa + Al(NO3)3 → C6H18AlO9P3 + 3 NaNO3;Precursors that are used for the fosetyl-Al production are aluminium nitrate (Al(NO3)3) and sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa).;;Glyphosate is produced in three steps from phosphorus trichloride:;PCl3 + 2 CH2O → CH2Cl3OP;CH2Cl3OP + H2O → CH4ClO3P + 2 HCl;CH4ClO3P + C2H5NO2 → C3H8NO5P + HCl;A precursor that is used for the glyphosate production is glycine (C2H5NO2).;;Parathion-methyl is produced in two steps from phenol:;C6H6O + HNO3 → C6H5NO3 + H2O;C6H5NO3 + C2H6ClO2PS → C8H10NO5PS + HCl;A precursor that is used for the parathion-methyl production is dimethylthiophosphoryl chloride (DMPCT) (C2H6ClO2SP).;;Precursors:;;Aluminium nitrate (Al(NO3)3) is produced from aluminium hydroxide and nitric acid:;Al(OH)3 + 3 HNO3 → Al(NO3)3 + 3 H2O;;Diethyl thiophosphoryl chloride (DEPCT) (C4H10ClO2SP) is produced in three steps from phosphorus:;P4 + 10 S → 2 P2S5;P2S5 + 4 C2H6O → 4 C4H11O2S2P + H2S;C4H11O2S2P + Cl2 → C4H10ClO2SP + HCl + S;;Dimethyl dithiophosphoric acid (C2H7O2S2P) is produced in two steps from phosphorus:;P4 + 10 S → 2 P2S5;P2S5 + 4 CH4O → 4 C2H7O2S2P + H2S;;Dimethyl thiophosphoryl chloride (DMPCT) (C2H6ClO2SP) is produced in three steps from phosphorus:;P4 + 10 S → 2 P2S5;P2S5 + 4 CH4O → 4 C2H7O2S2P + H2S;C2H7O2S2P + Cl2 → C2H6ClO2SP + HCl + S;;Glycine (C2H5NO2) is produced in two steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + NH3 → C2H5NO2 + HCl;;Methylamine (CH5N) is produced from methanol and ammonia:;CH4O + NH3 → CH5N + H2O;;Sodium amide (NaNH2) is produced in two steps from sodium chloride:;2 NaCl → 2 Na + Cl2;2 Na + 2 NH3 → 2 NaNH2 + H2;;Sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa) is produced from ethanol and sodium hydroxide:;C2H6O + NaOH → C2H5ONa + H2O;;Sodium nitrate (NaNO3) is produced from nitric acid and sodium carbonate:;HNO3 + Na2CO3 → NaNO3 + CO2 + H2O;;Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is produced in two steps from sulphur:;S + Cl2 → SCl2;SCl2 + SO2 + Cl2 → 2 SOCl2

exchanges.description:
Organo-phosphorous compounds can have different modes of action. Glyphosate, which is a herbicide, acts as inhibitor of 5-enolypyruvyl-shikimate-3-phosphate synthase (EPSP); Chlorpyrifos, Chlorpyrifos-methyl, Dimethoate, and Parathion-methyl, which are inseticides, are cholinesterase inhibitors; and Ethephon, which is a growth regulator, acts as an ethylene generator.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources.

flow.name: Methanol
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming that the remaining amount of unreacted input materials leave the production process with the wastewater, wich is further treated in an internal wastewater plant. For the nitrogen containing compounds within the wastewater a removal efficiency of 50% was assumed. The nitrogen emitted to air (N2) is neglected.

flow.name: Ammonium
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources. Remaining gases like CH4 or CO are oxidated to CO2. The carbon contained in the removed carbon compounds from wastewater treatment was accounted as CO2 emissions to air (assuming  a removal efficiency of 90%).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE

Kim et al. 2003. Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that includes 50% natural gas.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

flow.name: Phosphorus
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation, based on a production capacity of 50,000 t per year and a plant life time of 50 years, therefore an amount of 4X10-10 units per kg of produced chemical  is aded to the unit process of the respective chemical. The amount is accounted for each production step. This might be an overestimation in some multistep syntheses.
